document_data.name: Poisoner's Phial
document_data.mainbody: '''Poisoner's Phial''' was an apothecary shop in the [[gate-town]] of [[Plague-Mort]].{{Cite organized play/LC/No Place Like Home|28}}
document_data.Location: This shop was located in the Merchants' Quarter of Plague-Mort, one of the gate-towns of the [[Outlands]].<ref><ref group="note" name="location">The 4{{th}} edition sourcebook ''[[Demonomicon]]'' details this shop and the town of Plague-Mort as being within [[Pazunia]], the 1{{st}} layer of the [[Abyss]], though as this is not a Realms book and no other Realms-relevant sources acknowledge this, it can be firmly considered non-canon.
document_data.Services: This shop sold a variety of [[poison]]s, [[venom]]s, and their affiliated [[antidote]]s, as well as [[acid]]s and medications. Some of these antidotes were mundane, whilst others were [[magic]]al in nature. Antidotes were sold for twice that of what the shop charged for the toxins they were designed to neutralize.
document_data.History: Around the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], a group of [[adventurer]]s from the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] visited the gate-town of Plague-Mort and while there may have shopped at the Poisoner's Phial.
document_data.Inhabitants: This shop was owned and operated by a male [[tiefling]] by the name of [[Laran Susspurus]].
